alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 07 at 1:57PM CDT until May 08 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 5% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE PERMIAN BASIN, THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS, AND MOST OF THE TRANS PECOS... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 5% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE PERMIAN BASIN, THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS, AND MOST OF THE TRANS PECOS... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 5% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, THE PERMIAN BASIN, THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS, AND MOST OF THE TRANS PECOS... * AFFECTED AREA...Chinati Mountains and Central Brewster County. * TIMING...Sunday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 4 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.
